intro: Vincetoxicum officinale var. shuttleworthii, commonly known as Shuttleworth's yellow rue, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has compound leaves with a distinctive, slightly serrated margin. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
